intro: Pedicularis achilleifolia var. chacassica, commonly known as the Chacassica lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, characterized by its parasitic nature and lack of chlorophyll. The plant produces striking, spurred flowers in shades of red, orange, and yellow, which attract pollinators such as bees and hummingbirds. It typically grows in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Its botanical features include a hairy stem, opposite leaves, and a distinct floral structure with a long, narrow spur.
